definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
bubbling with humor (idiom); witty and interesting

sentences.english: Without air, there would be no wind or cloud.
sentences.chinese: 沒有空氣就不會有風和雲。

sentences.english: And I like windy weather, too.
If there is a wind, it knifes through your skin like stilettos.
sentences.chinese: 如果有風，也會如錐子一般刺穿你的皮膚。

sentences.english: It's windy and warm, so it's good weather for windsurfing.
sentences.chinese: 今天有風而且暖和，所以這種天氣很適合做帆板運動。

sentences.english: Dew will never gather while there is either heat or wind.
sentences.chinese: 有風或是有熱的時候，露珠凝結不起來。

sentences.english: You can see many falling leaves in the windy autumn days.
sentences.chinese: 在秋天有風的日子裏，你可以看見落葉飄飄。

sentences.english: He returned to the truck and drove into the windy night.
sentences.chinese: 他回到皮卡中，駛入有風的黑夜。

sentences.english: Linfen would be windy and its temperature would be twenty-three to thirty-two.
sentences.chinese: 臨汾有風，溫度是二十三到三十二。

sentences.english: Was that because of the wind, too?
sentences.chinese: 也是因爲有風，你才這樣做的？

definition: to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
wind and rain/the elements/trials and hardships
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
whatever/no matter what (who, how etc)/regardless of/not to discuss
to have or have not/surplus and shortfall/tangible and intangible/corporeal and incorporeal
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
